member.name: T:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstSpeakerProperties
member.summary: Used to communicate speaker properties to the host.
member.remarks: The origin for azimuth is right (as by math conventions dealing with radians). The elevation origin is also right, visualizing a rotation of a circle across the -pi/pi axis of the horizontal circle. Thus, an elevation of -pi/2 corresponds to bottom, and a speaker standing on the left, and 'beaming' upwards would have an azimuth of -pi, and an elevation of pi/2. For user interface representation, grads are more likely to be used, and the origins will obviously 'shift' accordingly.

member.summary: unit: rad, range: -PI...PI, exception: 10.f for LFE channel.

member.summary: unit: rad, range: -PI/2...PI/2, exception: 10.f for LFE channel.

member.remarks: The value must not exceed 64 characters.
member.exception: Thrown when the value exceeds 63 characters.

member.name: T:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo
member.summary: Used to communicate Time information to the plugin.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.Flags
member.summary: Time format Flags.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.SamplePosition
member.summary: The current Position in audio samples (always valid).
member.remarks: Current Position. It must always be valid, and should not cost a lot to ask for. The sample position is ahead of the time displayed to the user. In sequencer stop mode, its value does not change. A 32 bit integer is too small for sample positions, and it's a double to make it easier to convert between ppq and samples.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.SampleRate
member.summary: The current Sample Rate in Herz (always valid).

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.NanoSeconds
member.summary: System Time in nanoseconds (10^-9 second).

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.PpqPosition
member.summary: Musical Position, in Quarter Note (1.0 equals 1 Quarter Note).
member.remarks: At tempo 120, 1 quarter makes 1/2 second, so 2.0 ppq translates to 48000 samples at 48kHz sample rate. .25 ppq is one sixteenth note then. if you need something like 480ppq, you simply multiply ppq by that scaler.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.Tempo
member.summary: current Tempo in BPM (Beats Per Minute).

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.BarStartPosition
member.summary: last Bar Start Position, in Quarter Note.
member.remarks: Say we're at bars/beats readout 3.3.3. That's 2 bars + 2 q + 2 sixteenth, makes 2 * 4 + 2 + .25 = 10.25 ppq. at tempo 120, that's 10.25 * .5 = 5.125 seconds, times 48000 = 246000 samples.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.CycleStartPosition
member.summary: Cycle Start (left locator), in Quarter Note.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.CycleEndPosition
member.summary: Cycle End (right locator), in Quarter Note.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.TimeSignatureNumerator
member.summary: Time Signature Numerator (e.g. 3 for 3/4)

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.TimeSignatureDenominator
member.summary: Time Signature Denominator (e.g. 4 for 3/4)

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.SmpteOffset
member.summary: SMPTE offset (in SMPTE subframes (bits; 1/80 of a frame)).
member.remarks: The current SMPTE position can be calculated using #samplePos, #sampleRate, and #smpteFrameRate.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.SmpteFrameRate
member.summary: Smpte frame rate.

member.name: P:Jacobi.Vst.Core.VstTimeInfo.SamplesToNearestClock
member.summary: MIDI Clock Resolution (24 Per Quarter Note), can be negative (nearest clock).
member.remarks: MIDI Clock Resolution (24 per Quarter Note), can be negative the distance to the next midi clock (24 ppq, pulses per quarter) in samples. unless samplePos falls precicely on a midi clock, this will either be negative such that the previous MIDI clock is addressed, or positive when referencing the following (future) MIDI clock.
